reviews.title: Impressive and imposing at the square
reviews.text: A wedding was going on and the inner yard with the picturesque fountain was accessible. That enabled some nice photos of the gothic tower from a different angle. I am trying to give practical suggestions to fellow travelers through my reviews, therefore I suggest to “look-up” at different times of the day and night to see how the Town-Hall can “transform”. That tower view was engraved in my memory due to a visit happened many years ago. I was in Brussels to watch a football match of my favorite team AEK Athens against Anderlecht in Constant van de Stock stadium. After the match, at approx. midnight, we drove downtown and we stared at the town-hall tower with background a full-moon and by-passing clouds. A gothic scenery from a black & white terror movie.

reviews.title: NIce building
reviews.text: This is a great place to visit to remind yourself of the quality of government practiced in Europe in the 14th century. Well preserved and has nice surrounding with some coffee's where you can sit and enjoy the view.

reviews.title: an interesting tour
reviews.text: paintings were great and the architecture is very good. Not too much for children probably more for couples. helps if you speak French or German the guides English was not good.

reviews.title: Nice building
reviews.text: Nice building if you enjoy architecture, not much activities to do at the building though. If you have little time skip this and check out the bigger attractions.

reviews.title: very nice
reviews.text: Espacially in the evening really nice to see! The market square is also nice and walking around the narrow streets around the market is really nice

reviews.title: magnificent
reviews.text: This huge building can be seen from miles away, and it will catch your eye. When you get close to it and see how detailed it is, it'll leave you in awe. The place is open to public on wednesdays, but there are no picturetaking allowed inside the building. When we went there it was on the first day of the flower carpet so it also gave us good viewpoints of it.

reviews.title: Hotel de Ville
reviews.text: It's hard to express the beauty of this breathtaking Gothic building...you just have to see it for yourself! Especially when the city lights it at night.

reviews.title: Very beautiful Town Hall
reviews.text: Located in Grand-Place you cannot miss it. Inside Town Hall, you can have a different view to the square. I recommend.

reviews.title: Wonderful Building
reviews.text: The Town Hall is a fantastic building to view. We went to the flower Carpet so were lucky enough to see inside. It is not usually open to the public- but if you get the chance then take it. Beautiful paintings,wall coverings, etc. We got to see the Marriage room- it looks almost medieval. Fantastic surroundings to get married in. We went out on the balcony too. Beautiful views of the whole square. Probably should have spent more time admiring it- but not really possible with a young child. The Square is dominated with wonderful buildings. Well worth a visit- preferably not when it is boiling hot though.

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful town halls in Europe!
reviews.text: I grabbed a chair and sat in front of the town hall (with a glass of Leffe Blonde) and just looked at the facade for a few hours. There are many statues across the front from local people to royalty in differently attires. The workmanship is incredible and the statues look like real people (not like today's modern art where it looks similar but the artist does not have the skill or talent to make it look real so they call it modern art as a poor excuse for their lack of skill!) There are exhibits sometimes in the museum which are interesting! It is also fun to read the 'banns' about people who want to get married. I see many people walk by and hardly notice the beauty and love that was put into the building. Grab a chair and just look at the details. Even the magnificent statue on the tower. It will take your breath away to see such wonderful artwork and skill!

reviews.title: Couldn't understand the tour guide ...
reviews.text: Would have enjoyed this visit better had the tour guide had a good command of English. We could not understand what she was saying, and neither could many other people in the group, judging by the expressions on their faces. Because of this, she didn't hold the group together very well - that's not good! She half-heartedly told the group there were no photographs to be taken. She was largely ignored but she never did anything about it. It's a beautiful building, just a pity we knew as much coming out as we did going in. It's also a pity that we only saw a small portion of it.

reviews.title: Old building
reviews.text: Great if you like old buildings and Belgian history. If not just photograph the outside as it is amazing, can see why the whole square is a unesco world heritage site

reviews.title: Enjoyable Guided visit
reviews.text: It is a nice place, full of history and since the ticket is not expensive, it is worth visiting it. The visit takes about 45 minutes and is guided. You don't get fed up with historical details that you wouldn't care about but rather interesting things.

reviews.title: Visit the Grand Dame of Town Halls
reviews.text: This complex, which was built in the 16th century, is awe inspiring. Looks more like a grand cathedral with a very imposing tower.

reviews.title: Yet again a piece of architecture
reviews.text: Beautiful piece of architecture in the middle of the city. Huge building constructed in 15th century is still doing wonders. Must go location to have some pics.

reviews.title: Proud of the city
reviews.text: Built in the beginning of the 15th century in two phases, it emphasises the importance of the City of Brussels in trying to convince the Dukes of Burgundy to make Brussels its main residence on the Coudenberg.

reviews.title: tower not in the middle
reviews.text: the entire square is a must in Brussels , restaurants too expensive

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe
reviews.text: Rome's got the Colisseum, Paris the Eiffel Tower, and Athens the Parthenon, but Brussels has the Hotel de Ville, or City Hall. What a magnificent building in the most splendid Gothic architecture you have ever seen. Stunning. Sits in Grand Place, one of Europe's most beautiful squares. Lit up at night also! Run there.

reviews.title: Beautiful building
reviews.text: I have once visited the Town Hall. Beautiful !
